isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING SLEEPER LIGHTING AND ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Bunk Fluorescent and Reading Lights W/48, 60 Inch Flat Roof Sleeper

svcproc.title: Bunk Fluorescent and Reading Lights W/48, 60 Inch Flat Roof Sleeper
svcproc.para: When the bunk dome light switch is moved at either of the two locations, current will flow from battery stud B2, through circuit 14AP, fuse F8 - D, circuit 14AX, 14P, 14N, fuse L3, circuit 63AC, and 63F to the bunk fluorescent light. The ground circuit is 11U or 11P between the two switches, and circuit 11C, and 11B to sleeper ground.

When the bunk reading light switch is turned ON, current will flow from battery stud B2, through circuit 14AP, fuse F8 - D, circuit 14AX, 14P, 14N, fuse L3, circuit 63AC, and 63D to the reading light switch and lamp. The ground circuit is 11R and 11B to sleeper ground.
